test.name: validate data in table

kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.
kw.msg: Connecting using : pymysql.connect(db=mydb, user=root, passwd=Mysql2022@@@, host=127.0.0.1, port=3306, charset=None)

kw.name: Check If Exists In Database
kw.doc: Check if any row would be returned by given the input `selectStatement`. If there are no results, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Check If Exists In Database | select * from mydb.person where first_name="amit";
Executing : Query | select * from mydb.person where first_name="amit";

kw.name: Check If Not Exists In Database
kw.msg: Executing : Check If Not Exists In Database | select * from mydb.person where first_name="hello";
Executing : Query | select * from mydb.person where first_name="hello";

kw.name: Table Must Exist
kw.doc: Check if the table given exists in the database. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count | SELECT * FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_name='mydb'
Table 'mydb' does not exist in the db

test.status: Table 'mydb' does not exist in the db
